states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Ba a 20 day Minnesota resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Minnesota driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security number if you do not have a lisence or identification card

Note that you can register in person on election day. You will need to bring an official photo id (such as your driver's lisence or U.S. Passport)

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Nebraska driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security number if you do not have a lisence or identification card

Note that you can register in person on election day. You will need to bring an official photo id (such as your driver's lisence or U.S. Passport)

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Minnesota Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of Minnestota Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Election Office or the state Secretary of State Office

Items required

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 17.5 years old.
  • Be a Missouri resident.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Missouri driver's license
  • Social Security Number

Steps

  1. You can receive and fill out a paper form at the following places:
    • County Clerk's Office
    • Dpartment of Motor Vehicles Office
    • Other state Agencies that offer state public assistance
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Missouri driver's license
  • Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Missouri Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request. Note that your form varies with each county.
  2. Complete State of Missouri Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your local Election authority.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Be a 30 day Montana Resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • NOT be declared mentally incompetent by a court.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Montana driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security Number if you do not have a lisence

Steps

Note that you may fill out a registration form when you apply for or renew your driver's license or State of Montana ID at the office where you apply for or renew your Montana driverâ€™s license.

  1. Visit your county election office Monday through Friday between the hours of 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. and complete a registration form
  2. Fill out and sign a voter registration application and drop it off at your county election office, or mail it to the county election administrator.
  3. Return form to your county Election Official
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Montana driver's license or identification card
  • You may use your Social Security Number if you do not have a lisence

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Montana Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of Montana Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Election Administrator

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Be a 30 day Nevada resident.
  • Must be residing in the County you are registering in when you are voting
states.online:
Items required

  • Valid Nevada driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form. Note that this service is not always available (see site for more infomration).
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Nebraska driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing the online form request
  2. Complete State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county's clerk or Registar of Voters
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Nevada driver's license or identification card

Steps

  1. You can receive and fill out a paper form at the following places:
    • Dpartment of Motor Vehicles Office
    • County clerk or Registrar of Voter's Office
    • Various Social Service Agencies
    • College Campuses

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Must be residing in the County you are registering in when you are voting at least 10 days before the election.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid New Hampshire driver's license or identification card

Note that you may register in person at the polling place on election day. In this case, you will be asked to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.

Steps Otherwise

  1. Apply to your town or city clerkâ€™s office. You will be required to fill out a standard voter registration form and will be required to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.
  2. It may be easier for you to register with your communityâ€™s Supervisors of the Checklist. By law, they are required to meet on the Saturday 10 days prior to each election. Check the local newspaper(s) or call your clerkâ€™s office for the date and time of such meeting.
  3. Complete State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 17 years old.
  • Be a 30 Day New Jersey Resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony or be on probation.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid New Jersey driver's license or MVC identification card
  • If you do not have a liscence or card, you can use your social security number

Steps

  1. Obtain a State of New Jersey Mail-In Voter Registration Form by mail by filling out and printing the online form request. Note that your form varies by county.
  2. Complete State of New Jersey Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to yCounty Commisioner of Registration or Superintendent of Elections for your county.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • NOT in prison or have been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid North Carolina driver's license or identification card
  • Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Obtain State of North Carolina Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of North Carolina Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Board of Elections

states.eligibility: North Dakota is the only state where you do not have to register. When you go to vote, you simply need to present an official ID.

Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Be a 30 day Ohio Resident.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • NOT have previously violated election laws.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Valid Ohio driver's license or identification card
  • Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Ohio Mail-In Voter Registration Form by mail by filling out and printing the online form request
  2. Complete State of Ohio Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county Board of Elections or State Secretary of State office.
  4. You can also receive and fill out a paper form at the following places:
    • Secretary of State Office
    • County Board of Elections
    • High Schools and Vocational Schools
    • County Treasurer Offices
    • A number of other state Agencies
states.mail:
Items required

  • Valid Ohio driver's license or identification card
  • Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Obtain State of Ohio Mail-In Voter Registration Form by filling out and printing an online form request.
  2. Complete State of Ohio Mail-In Voter Registration Form.
  3. Return form to your county board of elections or state Secretary of State office.

    • County Election Board
    • Libraries
    • Post Offices
    • A number of other public locations
